intro: Effusiella arcuata, commonly known as the clustered goldenstar, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly in moist woodlands and stream banks. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits. Effusiella arcuata is also an important food source for various pollinators and insects.
